Question
========

According to the World Bank, about 35% of all people in Uganda in 1999 had less than €1 a day to spend. Suppose you repeatedly take a sample of 100 Ugandans and you count the number of people who had day had less than €1 to spend. What is then the mean and the standard deviation of this distribution?

Answerlist
----------

* Mean 0.35, standard deviation 0.2275
* Mean 35, standard deviation 0.2275
* Mean 35, standard deviation 0.4770
* Mean 35, standard deviation 4.7697
* Mean 35, standard deviation 22.75

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Mean 0.35, standard deviation 0.2275: Incorrect
* Mean 35, standard deviation 0.2275: Incorrect
* Mean 35, standard deviation 0.4770: Incorrect
* Mean 35, standard deviation 4.7697: Correct
* Average 35, standard deviation 22.75: Incorrect
